title: ARC names Ann J. Bruder as Vice President, General Counsel
text:
ARC names Ann J. Bruder as Vice President, General Counsel   09, 2015 eTN   
ARLINGTON, VA - Airlines Reporting Corp (ARC) announced today the selection of Ann J. Bruder as vice president and general counsel. As a member of the ARC executive team, she will advise senior leadership in an array of issues and lead the company’s internal legal department. Bruder, who replaces retired general counsel Kathi O’Neill, will begin her tenure at ARC later this month. 
“I’m tremendously excited about welcoming Ann to the ARC executive team,” said Mike Premo, ARC’s president and CEO. “Besides having a strong legal background at two major air carriers, Ann also brings us her expertise related to compliance and regulatory matters having worked for two global public companies and independently providing strategic planning and risk management services to corporations. She also understands the importance of close board-management relationships, which is so important to our business, and, as ARC continues to grow and expand our offerings, Ann will be invaluable in guiding us along our path.” 
A 25-year legal veteran, Bruder began her career as an attorney at the law firm of Thompson Coburn LLP in St. Louis, Missouri. She then moved to the former Continental Airlines, Inc., now United Airlines, Inc., and then American Airlines as its corporate and international counsel. Bruder most recently held senior executive positions at CARBO Ceramics Inc. as general counsel, corporate secretary and chief compliance officer and at Commercial Metals Company, where she was senior vice president, law, government affairs and global compliance, general counsel and corporate secretary. Presently, she is president of Global Strategic Services, LLC, a provider of strategic corporate, legal and advisory services to multinational corporations. 
Bruder is on the board of the Center for American and International Law and the International Women’s Forum, Dallas Chapter, and holds a bachelor’s degree in journalism/public relations from the University of Wyoming and a Juris Doctor degree from the Washington University School of Law.
